solution_line_template: The total ratio representing the yellow scores that Taylor got is {white_ratio_part}+{black_ratio_part}=<<{white_ratio_part}+{black_ratio_part}={total_ratio_parts}>>{total_ratio_parts}

The difference in the ratio between the number of black and white scores Taylor used is {white_ratio_part}-{black_ratio_part}=<<{white_ratio_part}-{black_ratio_part}={ratio_part_difference}>>{ratio_part_difference}

The fraction representing the difference in the ratio between the number of black and white scores Taylor used is {ratio_part_difference}/{total_ratio_parts}, representing {ratio_part_difference}/{total_ratio_parts}*{total_yellow_scores}={difference_in_scores}

{fraction_multiplier_numerator}/{fraction_multiplier_denominator} of the difference between the number of black and white scores Taylor used is {fraction_multiplier_numerator}/{fraction_multiplier_denominator}*{actual_difference}=<<{fraction_multiplier_numerator}/{fraction_multiplier_denominator}*{actual_difference}={final_answer_value}>>{final_answer_value}
